captions.text: Hey Vsauce, I'm Jake and ---

EXTREME FORKLIFTING. Cruise through the lot
on your lift, picking up pallets, putting
down pallets and getting BUCK WILD.

While showing off your forklift skillz, take
lots of pics...

14px. A fast paced and extremely fun platformer.
You play as a tiny inkblot on a mission to

save his friends, collect glowing sparks and
in the process, inadvertently die..again,

and again, and again. Once you've bested the
included 70 levels, you can go online and

build your own. Then share the death filled
levels with friends so they too can meet the

Reaper. Reaper is an action RPG that finds
you as the black swordsman, travelling into

the WIlderness vanquishing enemies with your
sword. You take on different missions given

to you by different people in order to gain
XP and earn gold to purchase better weapons

and armor. The game has a beautiful visual
style and really nice controls making it easy

to slice through your attackers. Especially
giant wasps. Stupid wasps. If you find yourself
stuck on a level, well that is quite the

Kunundrum, a puzzle game that seems easy enough
at first glance. You send the colored orbs

into their corresponding spots but if there
is nothing obstructing the orbs path, it will

go right past the target. You have to limit
your moves if you want the highest score and

things get hectic when more colors, portals
and directional arrows are introduced. For
something a bit simpler, try

Circa. Circa is a minimalistic news app that
gives you the facts and highlights of stories,

providing a quick and easy way to get caught
up with current events. One of the coolest

features is that you can follow certain articles
you're interested in to be updated when more

news occurs. If you get tired of what's happening
in our world go check out a

Little Galaxy, a game where you jump from
planet to planet collecting stars. Each celestial

body you encounter spins, so you have to time
your launch or else be thrown into the vastness

of space. As the game progresses more obstacles
like suns come into play that change the games

gravity entirely and you have to use them
to boomerang yourself to the destination.

The game has a beautiful visual style and
once on a planet see if it has a

Shufflepuck Cantina, an intergalactic air
hockey game. It feels like being inside the

cantina from Star Wars except you shoot first,
with an air hockey puck. The game is surprisingly

immersive for one centered around a table
game but it is also incredibly fun. The premise

is that you've crash landed on an alien planet
and must earn enough to get a ship that can

get you back to Earth. The cantina is filled
with a variety of characters that you can

challenge to a match. As you get to know them,
you can unlock their bios which then enables

you to play as them. The more matches you
win, the better puck, mallett, and special

moves you can unlock on your journey up the
levels to supreme victory. If you aren't great

at air hockey, at least the planet you crashed
on has

Nice Weather. Similar to Circa, Nice Weather
is a very clean and bare bones app. It presents

the weekly forecast in a beautiful way, and
the background color will change depending

on time of day and temperature - making it
very easy to track what the temperature will

be like throughout the day. Now, take a seat
a let me tell you a story...

of Choices. The Story of Choices is a pixelated
choose your own adventure game. You awake

as the messenger for the king. Or you could
just snooze instead of waking. Every decision

you make affects future choices and the final
outcome of the game. Also, it has a pretty

rad chiptune soundtrack. The game is a bit
short though so let's continue the story with
this episodes app of the week...

Device 6. Device 6 is a...difficult one to
describe...it is a puzzle, mystery, interactive

book game. Visually it is a mash-up of Mad
Men and Sean Connery era James Bond. You find

yourself as Anna who is in a strange castle
and must find out why and how to escape. Device

6 has incredible sound design and almost reads
like House of Leaves where the text becomes

a character, splitting in different directions
and forcing you to decide which path to follow.

You will spend a lot of time looking weird
in public spinning your phone or tablet trying

to literally follow the narrative. I really
don't want to give too much away about this

amazingly awesome puzzle mystery book game
so yeah, get it.

Links to all the apps can be found in the
description below.
I'm Jake and, as always, thanks for watching.
BOO-nus APPS!

Dead Effect is a first person shooter on a
spaceship where you blow away zombies. There

are hordes of enemies to mow through and boss
battles to be had but really, who doesn't

just need some good old zombie huntin to make
the day brighter? After the blood bath, take
a walk in

The Dark Meadow. Dark Meadow is a melee combat
horror game. You wake up in an abandoned hospital

not knowing why with only a voice over the
intercom slowly filling you in and hinting

at the terrors you have to face. As you search
the hallways and rooms for clues you will

be greeted by monsters to defeat. Or just
run away from them entirely in

Nightmare Runner, an endless runner that has
you escaping and shooting at Lovecraftian
creatures.
